Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2009 03:12AM kiwifriend wrote: Swelling does take little while to go down, When you consider there has been a foreign body inside your own body and god knows how much fiddling around went on during the operation - just be patient it all takes time.  If you have  nodes removed you will also find the swelling under your arms gets firm before it gets softer, and maybe you need to ask your breastcare nurse to show you how to massage fluid that would normally collect in these areas towards your groin area. It was explained to me that it takes time for the fluid to sort it out for themselves, in the meantime we need to give it a little helping hand.  If you are unwell and your temp reaches 40 celcuis (sorry, we deal in metric here) you need to contact someone - were you given a special phone number in emergencies - I was given a card which had instructions to any A&E  dept to follow, which stated I was a BC patient and the regimne they need to follow for your care.  Good luck and always listern to your body.  Go girl!
